subject: RE: info on The installation of JUnit (was RE: [junit] JUnit Test ing  Standards)
msgSnippet: ok.  It appears that did not happen cleanly.  Also it seems we can get 3.6 if we used http://download.sourceforge.net/junit/junit3.6.zip Download the zip,
messageBody:
ok. It appears that did not happen cleanly. Also it seems we can get 3.6
if we used http://download.sourceforge.net/junit/junit3.6.zip

Download the zip, unzip it, and look at the README stored in
junit3.6/README.html

Michael Finney
Sun Certified Programmer for the Java 2 Platform
Sun Certified Developer for the Java 2 Platform


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Michael Finney [SMTP:mfinney@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 12, 2001 11:43 AM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: info on The installation of JUnit (was RE: [junit] JUnit
> Testing Standards)
>
> < <http://download.sourceforge.net/junit/junit3.5.zip>>
> The zip file is located at <http://www.junit.org/>
> from junit3.5/README.html#Installation
> 3.5 version...
> Installation
> Below are the installation steps for installing JUnit:
> unzip the junit.zip file
> add junit.jar to the CLASSPATH. For example: set
> classpath=%classpath%;INSTALL_DIR\junit3\junit.jar
> test the installation by using either the batch or the graphical
> TestRunner tool to run the tests that come with this release. All the
> tests
> should pass OK.
> Notice: that the tests are not contained in the junit.jar but in the
> installation directory directly. Therefore make sure that the installation
> directory is on the class path
> * for the batch TestRunner type:
> java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> * for the graphical TestRunner type:
> java junit.awtui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> * for the Swing based graphical TestRunner type:
> java junit.swingui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> Important: don't install the junit.jar into the extension directory of
> your
> JDK installation. If you do so the test class on the files system will not
> be found.
>
>
> Michael Finney
> Sun Certified Programmer for the Java 2 Platform
> Sun Certified Developer for the Java 2 Platform
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: ud up [SMTP:uddi88@...]

> > --- nixj14@... wrote:
> > > I've been placed in charge of learning the concepts
> > > of JUnit and
> > > reporting them back to our team. I've reviewed many
> > > of the messages
> > > in this archive and in the extreme progrogramming
> > > group archive. I
> > > haven't been able to find any Testing Standards
> > > besides those
> > > compiled in the "JUnit Best Practices" article. Are
> > > there any
> > > standards for validation or any general standards
> > > that anyone has
> > > incorporated in their own projects? The thought
> > > behind this is by
> > > alligning everyone into some basic testing standards
> > > we can document
> > > the process and use it as a requirements doc.
> > >
> >
> >
> > Send me some info on The installation of JUnit
> > I am facing some problems
> >
